questionText: Their parents made bequests before they died stating that the estate was to be divided in a specific manner; do they have to follow that?
explanation: If your father and mother did not share out their estates when they were still alive, such that each person took his share and disposed of it, then what they said is regarded as a bequest (wasiyyah) and a bequest to an heir is not to be executed except with the permission of the other heirs.
